channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report X-2024040120
item.description:
Report X-2024040120

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-10T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: GARDENA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Shipment discovered leaking during offload of courier's vehicle. Leak was caused by a small puncture on the bottom of the plastic jerrican. The leak did not escape the truck and did not leak on the roadway. The plastic jerrican was placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper. Product information: Permaclean, PC-97, CR4B0561A1

item.title: Report E-2024040100
item.description:
Report E-2024040100

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-09T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 1 ounce of “Wet Look” Lacquer" UN1139 was released from one (1) 5-gallon metal drum due to a nail from a pallet. The release impacted the dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable with terminal personnel cleaning the release with the PPE available on-site. The damaged product and impacted oil dri were containerized in one (1) 10-gallon metal drum.

item.title: Report E-2024040074
item.description:
Report E-2024040074

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-08T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 28, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1760 had a damaged cap and released approximately one (1) quart of product to the top of the drum. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized a neutralizing solution and absorbent pads to wipe down the drum, then proceeded to repair the seal of the drum. Crews ensured there was no more leak, and the drum of product was good for shipment before staging it for further handling by terminal personnel. One (1) 5-gallon bucket of impacted absorbent pads and cleanup debris was labeled and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report E-2024040108
item.description:
Report E-2024040108

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-08T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to a nail puncture from the pallet, approximately 1-teaspoon of Wet Look Lacquer (hazardous - UN1139) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. No drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. The released product, damaged can, and Oil-Dri were placed into a 10-gallon metal drum and staged in OS&D.

item.title: Report E-2024040106
item.description:
Report E-2024040106

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-08T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported a one teaspoon release of regulated UN1263 "2.1 LOW V.O.C. CLEARCOAT" was released at Terminal USA. The caller stated that (1) a five-liter jerrycan that was punctured by a nail in it's pallet impacting the trailer. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal who felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE. (1) 10-gallon metal drum containing the impacted "Oil Dri" absorbent material, the damaged jerrycan, the remaining material, and issued PPE was containerized as waste and it was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024040018
item.description:
Report E-2024040018

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that regulated UN1203 "VP SEF 4-Cycle Fuel" was released from two (2) one-gallon metal pails impacting their box and Trailer #311-7506 due to the pail lids not being secured. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE. The generated waste was placed into one (1) 20-gallon poly drum containing the impacted Oil Dri absorbents, the damaged metal pails, and the PPE.

item.title: Report E-2024040054
item.description:
Report E-2024040054

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-09
  • City: AZUSA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee was unloading drums from a trailer at Veolia's ten day intransit facility in Azusa, CA. The employee used a forklift with a drum grabber attachment to pick up the 55 poly drum by it's lip. Prior to moving the drum, the drum appeared to be in good condition as there was no visible deficiencies identified by the forklift operator. Once the employee began to back up the drum, the drum lip broke off causing the drum to fall and break. Approximately 20 gallons was released onto the trailer and cement floor (all in secondary containment). The spill was immediately cleaned up. After investigating the incident, Veolia believes that the plastic was brittle but unfortunately, we are not sure of the cause of the brittleness since the site only utilizes a few of these drums.
